CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 12, 1970, pg. 15, reads: "Mrs. Leo C. Harper Jr...nee Thelma A. Lovette." Portions of accompanying article read: "Thelma Lovette Makes Lovely Summer Bride - One of the season's liveliest brides was Miss Thelma A. Lovette who plighted her troth recently with Leo C. Harper Jr. in a beautiful candlelight ceremony at Grace Memorial Church.  The bride's wedding gown was white, silk organza, empire waist, camelot sleeves, trimmed in venise lave with a detachable Watteau chapel train....  Mrs. Roslyn Wood (cousin of the bride) of Detroit, Mich., was maid of honor; Mrs. Sharon Goode was the maid of honor; bridesmaids were Misses Gail Carter (cousin of the bride) Judie Johns of Cleveland, Ohio, and Arnita West; flower girls (both cousins of the bride) were Valarie Wood of Detroit, Mich., and Lori Hord.  Best man and soloist was Timothy Stevens.  Ushers were Ronald Harper (groom's brother0, Harry Scott, Robert West, James Saylor, Robert Daniels, and Charles Franklin.  The Rev. J. E. Fawcett officiated at the ceremony.  Mrs. Harper is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William Lovette of Webster Avenue.  The groom is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Leo C. Haprer [Harper] St. of North Fairmont Street.  The bride was a May graduate of Carlow College; the groom will graduate in December from the University of Pittsburgh..."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of bride Thelma Lovette Harper wearing gown with empire waist and gathered sleeves, posed under wire arch in Grace Memorial Church
